description.plain:
Cody Johnson (21 May 1987 -) is a country singer-songwriter from Huntsville, Texas.  Born in Sebastopol, Texas, he’s been playing country music since he was 12. He followed his father and became a prison guard in Huntsville, while playing honky tonks on the weekends.  It was the prison governor or warden who suggested Johnson take up music full time. That was in 2006, and since then he’s released six albums. Each of those has sold better than the last, with his 2016 release, Gotta Be Me, selling in the top five country albums. He’s done all that while remaining independent; he publishes his own music under his CoJo label.

Johnson has developed a loyal fan base, and it’s growing every year. He named George Strait, Garth Brooks, Chris LeDoux and Merle Haggard as his influencers.

body.plain:
Cody Johnson (21 May 1987 -) is a country singer-songwriter from Huntsville, Texas.  Born in Sebastopol, Texas, he’s been playing country music since he was 12. He followed his father and became a prison guard in Huntsville, while playing honky tonks on the weekends.  It was the prison governor or warden who suggested Johnson take up music full time. That was in 2006, and since then he’s released six albums. Each of those has sold better than the last, with his 2016 release, Gotta Be Me, selling in the top five country albums. He’s done all that while remaining independent; he publishes his own music under his CoJo label.

Johnson has developed a loyal fan base, and it’s growing every year. He named George Strait, Garth Brooks, Chris LeDoux and Merle Haggard as his influencers.

songs.full_title: On My Way to You by Cody Johnson
songs.title: On My Way to You

description.plain:
“On My Way To You” is a country power ballad that Cody released as the first single off his album Ain’t Nothin' to It.

The song describes how the narrator has lived his life with many mistakes. He describes “all the hell [he’s] caused” and “all the love [he’s] lost” while acknowledging that he found his true significant other along the way which made it all worth it.

In an interview about the song, Cody explained that his wife Brandi had an even bigger influence than just being part of the inspiration; she also made all the decisions for the video.He also explained why he is proud of the song:

I feel like it’s very relatable… It’s a great storyline that paints an incredible picture. The melody was already pretty dynamic.

body.plain:
“On My Way To You” is a country power ballad that Cody released as the first single off his album Ain’t Nothin' to It.

The song describes how the narrator has lived his life with many mistakes. He describes “all the hell [he’s] caused” and “all the love [he’s] lost” while acknowledging that he found his true significant other along the way which made it all worth it.

In an interview about the song, Cody explained that his wife Brandi had an even bigger influence than just being part of the inspiration; she also made all the decisions for the video.He also explained why he is proud of the song:

I feel like it’s very relatable… It’s a great storyline that paints an incredible picture. The melody was already pretty dynamic.

songs.lyrics:
10 ContributorsOn My Way to You Lyrics[Verse 1]
All the boats I've missed
All the hell I've caused
All the lips I've kissed
All the love I've lost
I got kicked around
I've been black and blue
On my way to you

[Verse 2]
All the stars I've seen
All the songs I've sung
All the beers I've drank
All the damage done
I was just passin' time
Kinda just passin' through
On my way to you

[Chorus]
Every curve, every ditch
Every turn, every bridge
I left behind me up in smoke
Every fork in the road
It was all worth the while
When I finally saw your smile
Every highway, every heartbreak
Every mountain, every mile
You might also like[Verse 3]
I got the radio up
Sun is going down
I’ll take a left at the bank
And I’ll head straight through town
So baby, put on that dress
A little sweet perfume
‘Cause I’m on my way to you

[Instrumental Break]

[Chorus]
Yeah, every curve, every ditch
Every turn, every bridge
I left behind me up in smoke
Every fork in the road
It was all worth the while
When I finally saw your smile
Every highway, every heartbreak
Every mountain, every mile

[Verse 4]
All the boats I’ve missed
All the hell I’ve caused
All the lips I’ve kissed
All the love I’ve lost
I thank God for that
I guess he always knew
I was on my way to you
[Outro]
On my way to you
On my way to you2Embed

songs.lyrics:
11 ContributorsNothin’ On You Lyrics[Verse 1]
Wearin' your black dress, red shoes, makeup, perfume, and diamonds
You always impress, turn heads, the second you walk through the door
You're like a real-life work of fine art, baby, you're priceless
But I just wanna get home, get that black dress down on the floor

[Chorus]
'Cause when you got nothin' on
There ain't nothin' wrong
Lovin' you all night long's
All I wanna do
I've seen the mountains high
I've sailed the ocean blue
But when you got nothin' on
Ain't nothin' got nothin' on you

[Verse 2]
You're better than Venice, Vegas, New York, LA, or Paris
Baby, you're Vermont in the fall, the Grand Canyon on a full moon
Oh, and they can keep those highrise, high price mansions, I wouldn't trade places
Long as I'm here with you, baby, I've got a room with a view

[Chorus]
'Cause when you got nothin' on
There ain't nothin' wrong
Lovin' you all night long's
All I wanna do
I've seen the mountains high
I've sailed the ocean blue
But when you got nothin' on
Ain't nothin' got nothin' on you
You might also like[Guitar Solo]

[Outro]
Yeah, 'cause I've seen the mountains high
I've sailed the ocean blue
But when you got nothin' on
Ain't nothin' got nothin' on you
When you got nothin' on
Ain't nothin' got nothin' on you
Ain't nothin' got nothin' on you, baby1Embed

songs.lyrics:
5 ContributorsAin’t Nothin’ to It Lyrics[Verse 1]
Same old scenario
One guy's young and one guy's old
One's in love and sittin' on Go
And one's already walked that road
One's on year number 33
And one just bought that diamond ring
One says "Dad, so how'd you do it?"
The other just laughs and says "There ain't nothin' to it"

[Chorus]
Just try to quit smokin' and reel back the drinkin'
Don't always tell her everything you're thinkin'
And dance her when she needs dancin'
You get up and go to work, get up and go to church
Crawl up in that bed right next to her and listen
Instead of having all the answers
Then he slapped him on the back and said
"Son, you can do it, there ain't nothin' to it"

[Verse 2]
There'll be trouble along the way
Words will fly and dishes break
The baby comes in and money goes out
You will learn to ride the ups and downs
You'll wanna quit a million times
But if you hang on, the years unwind
And when you get to see your blushing bride
Turn beautiful at 35, or 45, or 55
You might also like[Chorus]
You'll be glad you quit smokin' and reeled back the drinkin'
Didn't always tell her everything you were thinkin'
And danced her when she needed dancin'
You got up and went to work, got up and went to church
Crawled up in that bed right next to her and listened
Instead of having all the answers
It's only love and all of us go through it
And if I had to do it again you know I'd do it
There ain't nothin' to it
No, there ain't nothin' to it1Embed
